byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran.

abstract: Iran’s former ambassador to France, Seyed Mehdi Miraboutalebi, says Iran knew about Central Intelligence Agency consultant Robert A Levinson's disappearance in 2007, and was willing to release him if United States helped delay formal critique of Iran's nuclear activities; Iranian leaders have long said they know nothing about Levinson's location or condition.
lead_paragraph: Newly disclosed documents conflict with Iran’s claim it knew nothing about the consultant Mr. Levinson who disappeared in Iran in 2007.

headline.main: Clues Emerge on Robert Levinson, C.I.A. Consultant Who Vanished in Iran
headline.print_headline: Clues Emerge on American Sought in Iran

snippet: Newly disclosed documents conflict with Iran’s claim it knew nothing about the consultant Mr. Levinson who disappeared in Iran in 2007.
